data.title: Delicious thai food
data.text: The thai waiter was very friendly and took our order promptly. We had the Somtum with Seafood, Larb and Pad Thai with pork. Having eaten these dishes many times in Thailand, i can safely say that everything was delicious. The prices were reasonable (about 8$ per dish). Recommended!

data.title: Best fried pork ever.
data.text: Wow.  I came here by mistake, but the food was so good and the people was very nice.  Definitely I will come again.  Only draw back and is not bad, they don't have any beers.

data.title: Flavor and freshness is their thing.
data.text: Words can not describe how I enjoy the food here. You must taste for yourself. Consistently good. The Orange chicken is awesome. The spicy Eggplant with veggies is mouth watering. Avocado rolls are a must have. Try with the served orange glaze and the red chili sauce at the table.

data.title: Hard to find but worth the effort
data.text: This tiny Thai restaurant is almost off the grid. It's between 130 and 129th street on Hawthorne Avenue, Hawthorne CA near LAX, and because of recent street improvements you have to take a little side-street, easy to miss, into this small shopping mall. The proprietor told us that until recently she just had a few tables; recently she's expanded into a slightly  larger space. It's a costly gamble but I'm certain she will succeed simply because of the quality of her food. My group of five ordered Teriyaki Chicken, Pad Thai with chicken, Pad Thai with Tofu, chicken fried rice and pineapple rice. Every dish was absolutely delicious, and $7.95 which is a true bargain. The restaurant is very clean,  with tasteful food that's  beautifully and simply presented. The recent expansion means you can probably find a seat, but this restaurant sees to have a very large take-out clientele so it's understandably busy. Sometimes you find a place that has the combination of ambiance (very simple!) and accommodation, and you really want them to succeed.I plan to take my group for supper on Sunday as well.
